verse: My darling! My darling! away, away beyond the Assembly and the Law and the Enlightenment unto an Anarchy of solitude and Darkness!

title: Liber Liberi Vel Lapidis Lazvli, Advmbratio Kabbalae AEgyptiorvm Svb Figvra VII
label: LIBER VII VII:44
verse: For even thus must we veil the brilliance of our Self.

title: Liber Liberi Vel Lapidis Lazvli, Advmbratio Kabbalae AEgyptiorvm Svb Figvra VII
label: LIBER VII VII:45
verse: My darling! My darling!

title: Liber Liberi Vel Lapidis Lazvli, Advmbratio Kabbalae AEgyptiorvm Svb Figvra VII
label: LIBER VII VII:46
verse: O my God, but the love in Me bursts over the bonds of Space and Time; my love is spilt among them that love not love.

title: Liber Liberi Vel Lapidis Lazvli, Advmbratio Kabbalae AEgyptiorvm Svb Figvra VII
label: LIBER VII VII:47
verse: My wine is poured out for them that never tasted wine.

title: Liber Liberi Vel Lapidis Lazvli, Advmbratio Kabbalae AEgyptiorvm Svb Figvra VII
label: LIBER VII VII:48
verse: The fumes thereof shall intoxicate them and the vigour of my love shall breed mighty children from their maidens.

title: Liber Liberi Vel Lapidis Lazvli, Advmbratio Kabbalae AEgyptiorvm Svb Figvra VII
label: LIBER VII VII:49
verse: Yea! without draught, without embrace: --- and the Voice answered Yea! these things shall be.

title: Liber Liberi Vel Lapidis Lazvli, Advmbratio Kabbalae AEgyptiorvm Svb Figvra VII
label: LIBER VII VII:50
verse: Then I sought a Word for Myself; nay, for myself.

title: Liber Liberi Vel Lapidis Lazvli, Advmbratio Kabbalae AEgyptiorvm Svb Figvra VII
label: LIBER VII VII:51
verse: And the Word came: O Thou! it is well. Heed naught! I love Thee! I love Thee!

title: Liber Liberi Vel Lapidis Lazvli, Advmbratio Kabbalae AEgyptiorvm Svb Figvra VII
label: LIBER VII VII:52
verse: Therefore had I faith unto the end of all; yea, unto the end of all.

title: Liber Porta Lucis.
label: LIBER X I:1
verse: I behold a small dark orb, wheeling in an abyss of infinite space. It is minute among a myriad vast ones, dark amid a myriad bright ones.

title: Liber Porta Lucis.
label: LIBER X I:2
verse: I who comprehend in myself all the vast and the minute, all the bright and the dark, have mitigated the brilliance of mine unutterable splendour, sending forth V.V.V.V.V. as a ray of my light, as a messenger unto that small dark orb.

title: Liber Porta Lucis.
label: LIBER X I:3
verse: Then V.V.V.V.V. taketh up the word, and sayeth:

title: Liber Porta Lucis.
label: LIBER X I:4
verse: Men and women of the Earth, to you am I come from the Ages beyond the Ages, from the Space beyond your vision; and I bring to you these words.

title: Liber Porta Lucis.
label: LIBER X I:5
verse: But they heard him not, for they were not ready to receive them.

title: Liber Porta Lucis.
label: LIBER X I:6
verse: But certain men heard and understood, and through them shall this Knowledge be made known.

title: Liber Porta Lucis.
label: LIBER X I:7
verse: The least therefore of them, the servant of them all, writeth this book.

title: Liber Porta Lucis.
label: LIBER X I:8
verse: He writeth for them that are ready. Thus is it known if one be ready, if he be endowed with certain gifts, if he be fitted by birth, or by wealth, or by intelligence, or by some other manifest sign. And the servants of the master by his insight shall judge of these.

title: Liber Porta Lucis.
label: LIBER X I:9
verse: This Knowledge is not for all men; few indeed are called, but of these few many are chosen.

title: Liber Porta Lucis.
label: LIBER X I:10
verse: This is the nature of the Work.

title: Liber Porta Lucis.
label: LIBER X I:11
verse: First, there are many and diI:conditions of life upon this earth. In all of these is some seed of sorrow. Who can escape from sickness and from old age and from death?

title: Liber Porta Lucis.
label: LIBER X I:12
verse: We are come to save our fellows from these things. For there is a life intense with knowledge and extreme bliss which is untouched by any of them.

title: Liber Porta Lucis.
label: LIBER X I:13
verse: To this life we attain even here and now. The adepts, the servants of V.V.V.V.V., have attained thereunto.

title: Liber Porta Lucis.
label: LIBER X I:14
verse: It is impossible to tell you of the splendours of that to which they have attained.

title: Liber Porta Lucis.
label: LIBER X I:15
verse: Little by little, as your eyes grow stronger, will we unveil to you the ineffable glory of the Path of the Adepts, and its nameless goal.

title: Liber Porta Lucis.
label: LIBER X I:16
verse: Even as a man ascending a steep mountain is lost to sight of his friends in the valley, so must the adept seem. They shall say: He is lost in the clouds. But he shall rejoice in the sunlight above them, and come to the eternal snows.

title: Liber Porta Lucis.
label: LIBER X I:17
verse: Or as a scholar may learn some secret language of the ancients, his friends shall say: [Look! he pretends to read this book. But it is unintelligible --- it is nonsense.] Yet he delights in the Odyssey, while they read vain and vulgar things.

title: Liber Porta Lucis.
label: LIBER X I:18
verse: We shall bring you to Absolute Truth, Absolute Light, Absolute Bliss.

title: Liber Porta Lucis.
label: LIBER X I:19
verse: Many adepts throughout the ages have sought to do this; but their words have been perverted by their successors, and again and again the Veil has fallen upon the Holy of Holies.

title: Liber Porta Lucis.
label: LIBER X I:20
verse: To you who yet wander in the Court of the Profane we cannot yet reveal all; but you will easily understand that the religions of the world are but symbols and veils of the Absolute Truth. So also are the philosophies. To the adept, seeing all these things from above, there seems nothing to choose between Buddha and Mohammed, between Atheism and Theism.

title: Liber Porta Lucis.
label: LIBER X I:21
verse: The many change and pass; the one remains. Even as wood and coal and iron burn up together in one great flame, if only that furnace be of transcendent heat; so in the alembic of this spiritual alchemy, if only the zelator blow sufficiently upon his furnace all the systems of earth are consumed in the One Knowledge.

title: Liber Porta Lucis.
label: LIBER X I:22
verse: Nevertheless, as a fire cannot be started with iron alone, in the beginning one system may be suited for one seeker, another for another.

title: Liber Porta Lucis.
label: LIBER X I:23
verse: We therefore who are without the chains of ignorance, look closely into the heart of the seeker and lead him by the path which is best suited to his nature unto the ultimate end of all things, the supreme realization, the Life which abideth in Light, yea, the Life which abideth in Light.

title: Liber Trigrammaton
label: LIBER XXVII I:1
verse: Here is Nothing under its three forms. It is not, yet informeth all things.

title: Liber Trigrammaton
label: LIBER XXVII I:2
verse: Now cometh the glory of the Single One, as an imperfection and stain.

title: Liber Trigrammaton
label: LIBER XXVII I:3
verse: But by the Weak One the Mother was it equilibrated.

title: Liber Trigrammaton
label: LIBER XXVII I:4
verse: Also the purity was divided by Strength, the force of the Demiurge.

title: Liber Trigrammaton
label: LIBER XXVII I:5
verse: And the Cross was formulated in the Universe that as yet was not.

title: Liber Trigrammaton
label: LIBER XXVII I:6
verse: But now the Imperfection became manifest, presiding over the fading of perfection.

title: Liber Trigrammaton
label: LIBER XXVII I:7
verse: Also the Woman arose, and veiled the Upper Heaven with her body of stars.

title: Liber Trigrammaton
label: LIBER XXVII I:8
verse: Now then a giant arose, of terrible strength; and asserted the Spirit in a secret rite.

title: Liber Trigrammaton
label: LIBER XXVII I:9
verse: And the Master of the Temple balancing all things arose; his stature was above the Heaven and below Earth and Hell.

title: Liber Trigrammaton
label: LIBER XXVII I:10
verse: Against him the Brothers of the Left-hand Path, confusing the symbols. They concealed their horror [in this symbol]; for in truth they were

title: Liber Trigrammaton
label: LIBER XXVII I:11
verse: The master flamed forth as a star and set a guard of Water in every Abyss.

title: Liber Trigrammaton
label: LIBER XXVII I:12
verse: Also certain secret ones concealed the Light of Purity in themselves, protecting it from the Persecutions.

title: Liber Trigrammaton
label: LIBER XXVII I:13
verse: Likewise also did certain sons and daughters of Hermes and of Aphrodite, more openly

title: Liber Trigrammaton
label: LIBER XXVII I:14
verse: But the Enemy confused them. They pretended to conceal that Light, that they might betray it, and profane it.

title: Liber Trigrammaton
label: LIBER XXVII I:15
verse: Yet certain holy nuns concealed the secret in songs upon the lyre.

title: Liber Trigrammaton
label: LIBER XXVII I:16
verse: Now did the Horror of Time pervert all things, hiding the Purity with a loathsome thing, a thing unnameable.

title: Liber Trigrammaton
label: LIBER XXVII I:17
verse: Yea, and there arose sensualists upon the firmament, as a foul stain of storm upon the sky.

title: Liber Trigrammaton
label: LIBER XXVII I:18
verse: And the Black Brothers raised their heads; yea, they unveiled themselves without shame or fear.

title: Liber Trigrammaton
label: LIBER XXVII I:19
verse: Also there rose up a soul of filth and of weakness, and it corrupted all the rule of the Tao.

title: Liber Trigrammaton
label: LIBER XXVII I:20
verse: Then only was Heaven established to bear sway; for only in the lowest corruption is form manifest.

title: Liber Trigrammaton
label: LIBER XXVII I:21
verse: Also did Heaven manifest in violent light,

title: Liber Trigrammaton
label: LIBER XXVII I:22
verse: And in soft light.

title: Liber Trigrammaton
label: LIBER XXVII I:23
verse: Then were the waters gathered together from the heaven,

title: Liber Trigrammaton
label: LIBER XXVII I:24
verse: And a crust of earth concealed the core of flame.

title: Liber Trigrammaton
label: LIBER XXVII I:25
verse: Around the globe gathered the wide air,

title: Liber Trigrammaton
label: LIBER XXVII I:26
verse: And men began to light fires upon the earth.

title: Liber Trigrammaton
label: LIBER XXVII I:27
verse: Therefore was the end of it sorrow; yet in that sorrow a sixfold star of glory whereby they might see to return unto the stainless Abode; yea, unto the Stainless Abode.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV I:1
verse:
I am the Heart; and the Snake is entwined
About the invisible core of the mind.
Rise, O my snake! It is now is the hour
Of the hooded and holy ineffable flower.
Rise, O my snake, into brilliance of bloom
On the corpse of Osiris afloat in the tomb!
O heart of my mother, my sister, mine own,
Thou art given to Nile, to the terror Typhon!
Ah me! but the glory of ravening storm
Enswathes thee and wraps thee in frenzy of form.
Be still, O my soul! that the spell may dissolve
As the wands are upraised, and the aeons revolve.
Behold! in my beauty how joyous Thou art,
O Snake that caresses the crown of mine heart!
Behold! we are one, and the tempest of years
Goes down to the dusk, and the Beetle appears.
O Beetle! the drone of Thy dolorous note
Be ever the trance of this tremulous throat!
I await the awaking! The summons on high
From the Lord Adonai, from the Lord Adonai!

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV I:2
verse: Adonai spake unto V.V.V.V.V., saying: There must ever be division in the word.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV I:3
verse: For the colours are many, but the light is one.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV I:4
verse: Therefore thou writest that which is of mother of emerald, and of lapis-lazuli, and of turquoise, and of alexandrite.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV I:5
verse: Another writeth the words of topaz, and of deep amethyst, and of gray sapphire, and of deep sapphire with a tinge as of blood.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV I:6
verse: Therefore do ye fret yourselves because of this.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV I:7
verse: Be not contented with the image.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV I:8
verse: I who am the Image of an Image say this.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV I:9
verse:
Debate not of the image, saying Beyond! Beyond!
One mounteth unto the Crown by the moon and by the Sun, and by the arrow, and by the Foundation, and by the dark home of the stars from the black earth.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV I:10
verse: Not otherwise may ye reach unto the Smooth Point.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV I:11
verse: Nor is it fitting for the cobbler to prate of the Royal matter. O cobbler! mend me this shoe, that I may walk. O king! if I be thy son, let us speak of the Embassy to the King thy Brother.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV I:12
verse:
Then was there silence. Speech had done with us awhile.
There is a light so strenuous that it is not perceived as light.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV I:13
verse: Wolf's bane is not so sharp as steel; yet it pierceth the body more subtly.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV I:14
verse: Even as evil kisses corrupt the blood, so do my words devour the spirit of man.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV I:15
verse: I breathe, and there is infinite dis-ease in the spirit.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV I:16
verse: As an acid eats into steel, as a cancer that utterly corrupts the body; so am I unto the spirit of man.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV I:17
verse: I shall not rest until I have dissolved it all.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV I:18
verse: So also the light that is absorbed. One absorbs little and is called white and glistening; one absorbs all and is called black.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV I:19
verse: Therefore, O my darling, art thou black.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV I:20
verse: O my beautiful, I have likened thee to a jet Nubian slave, a boy of melancholy eyes.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV I:21
verse:
O the filthy one! the dog! they cry against thee.
Because thou art my beloved.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV I:22
verse: Happy are they that praise thee; for they see thee with Mine eyes.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV I:23
verse: Not aloud shall they praise thee; but in the night watch one shall steal close, and grip thee with the secret grip; another shall privily cast a crown of violets over thee; a third shall greatly dare, and press mad lips to thine.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV I:24
verse: Yea! the night shall cover all, the night shall cover all.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV I:25
verse:
Thou wast long seeking Me; thou didst run forward so fast that I was unable to come up with thee.
O thou darling fool! what bitterness thou didst crown thy days withal.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV I:26
verse: Now I am with thee; I will never leave thy being.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV I:27
verse: For I am the soft sinuous one entwined about thee, heart of gold!

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV I:28
verse: My head is jewelled with twelve stars; My body is white as milk of the stars; it is bright with the blue of the abyss of stars invisible.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV I:29
verse: I have found that which could not be found; I have found a vessel of quicksilver.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV I:30
verse: Thou shalt instruct thy servant in his ways, thou shalt speak often with him.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV I:31
verse: (The scribe looketh upwards and crieth) Amen! Thou hast spoken it, Lord God!

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV I:32
verse: Further Adonai spake unto V.V.V.V.V. and said:

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV I:33
verse:
Let us take our delight in the multitude of men!
Let us shape unto ourselves a boat of mother-of-pearl from them, that we may ride upon the river of Amrit!

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV I:34
verse: Thou seest yon petal of amaranth, blown by the wind from the low sweet brows of Hathor?

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV I:35
verse: (The Magister saw it and rejoiced in the beauty of it.) Listen!

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV I:36
verse:
(From a certain world came an infinite wail.)
That falling petal seemed to the little ones a wave to engulph their continent.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV I:37
verse: So they will reproach thy servant, saying: Who hath set thee to save us?

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV I:38
verse: He will be sore distressed.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV I:39
verse: All they understand not that thou and I are fashioning a boat of mother-of-pearl. We will sail down the river of Amrit even to the yew-groves of Yama, where we may rejoice exceedingly.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV I:40
verse: The joy of men shall be our silver gleam, their woe our blue gleam --- all in the mother-of-pearl.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV I:41
verse:
(The scribe was wroth thereat. He spake:
O Adonai and my master, I have borne the inkhorn and the pen without pay, in order that I might search this river of Amrit, and sail thereon as one of ye. This I demand for my fee, that I partake of the echo of your kisses.)

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV I:42
verse: (And immediately it was granted unto him.)

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV I:43
verse: (Nay; but not therewith was he content. By an infinite abasement unto shame did he strive. Then a voice:)

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV I:44
verse: Thou strivest ever; even in thy yielding thou strivest to yield --- and lo! thou yieldest not.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV I:45
verse: Go thou unto the outermost places and subdue all things.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV I:46
verse: Subdue thy fear and thy disgust. Then --- yield!

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV I:47
verse: There was a maiden that strayed among the corn, and sighed; then grew a new birth, a narcissus, and therein she forgot her sighing and her loneliness.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV I:48
verse: Even instantly rode Hades heavily upon her, and ravished her away.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV I:49
verse: (Then the scribe knew the narcissus in his heart; but because it came not to his lips, therefore was he shamed and spake no more.)

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV I:50
verse:
Adonai spake yet again with V.V.V.V.V. and said:
The earth is ripe for vintage; let us eat of her grapes, and be drunken thereon.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV I:51
verse: And V.V.V.V.V. answered and said: O my lord, my dove, my excellent one, how shall this word seem unto the children of men?

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV I:52
verse:
And He answered him: Not as thou canst see.
It is certain that every letter of this cipher hath some value; but who shall determine the value? For it varieth ever, according to the subtlety of Him that made it.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV I:53
verse:
And He answered Him: Have I not the key thereof?
I am clothed with the body of flesh; I am one with the Eternal and Omnipotent God.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV I:54
verse: Then said Adonai: Thou hast the Head of the Hawk, and thy Phallus is the Phallus of Asar. Thou knowest the white, and thou knowest the black, and thou knowest that these are one. But why seekest thou the knowledge of their equivalence?

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV I:55
verse: And he said: That my Work may be right.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV I:56
verse:
And Adonai said: The strong brown reaper swept his swathe and rejoiced. The wise man counted his muscles, and pondered, and understood not, and was sad.
Reap thou, and rejoice!

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV I:57
verse:
Then was the Adept glad, and lifted his arm.
Lo! an earthquake, and plague, and terror on the earth!
A casting down of them that sate in high places; a famine upon the multitude!

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV I:58
verse: And the grape fell ripe and rich into his mouth.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV I:59
verse: Stained is the purple of thy mouth, O brilliant one, with the white glory of the lips of Adonai.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV I:60
verse: The foam of the grape is like the storm upon the sea; the ships tremble and shudder; the shipmaster is afraid.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV I:61
verse: That is thy drunkenness, O holy one, and the winds whirl away the soul of the scribe into the happy haven.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV I:62
verse: O Lord God! let the haven be cast down by the fury of the storm! Let the foam of the grape tincture my soul with Thy light!

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV I:63
verse: Bacchus grew old, and was Silenus; Pan was ever Pan for ever and ever more throughout the aeons.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV I:64
verse: Intoxicate the inmost, O my lover, not the outermost!

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV I:65
verse: So was it --- ever the same! I have aimed at the peeled wand of my God, and I have hit; yea, I have hit.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV II:1
verse: I passed into the mountain of lapis-lazuli, even as a green hawk between the pillars of turquoise that is seated upon the throne of the East.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV II:2
verse: So came I to Duant, the starry abode, and I heard voices crying aloud.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV II:3
verse:
O Thou that sittest upon the Earth! (so spake a certain Veiled One to me) thou art not greater than thy mother! Thou speck of dust infinitesimal!
Thou art the Lord of Glory, and the unclean dog.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV II:4
verse: Stooping down, dipping my wings, I came unto the darkly-splendid abodes. There in that formless abyss was I made a partaker of the Mysteries Averse.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV II:5
verse: I suffered the deadly embrace of the Snake and of the Goat; I paid the infernal homage to the shame of Khem.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV II:6
verse: Therein was this virtue, that the One became the all.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV II:7
verse: Moreover I beheld a vision of a river. There was a little boat thereon; and in it under purple sails was a golden woman, an image of Asi wrought in finest gold. Also the river was of blood, and the boat of shining steel. Then I loved her; and, loosing my girdle, cast myself into the stream.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV II:8
verse: I gathered myself into the little boat, and for many days and nights did I love her, burning beautiful incense before her.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV II:9
verse: Yea! I gave her of the flower of my youth.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV II:10
verse: But she stirred not; only by my kisses I defiled her so that she turned to blackness before me.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV II:11
verse: Yet I worshipped her, and gave her of the flower of my youth.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV II:12
verse: Also it came to pass, that thereby she sickened, and corrupted before me. Almost I cast myself into the stream.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV II:13
verse: Then at the end appointed her body was whiter than the milk of the stars, and her lips red and warm as the sunset, and her life of a white heat like the heat of the midmost sun.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV II:14
verse: Then rose she up from the abyss of Ages of Sleep, and her body embraced me. Altogether I melted into her beauty and was glad.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV II:15
verse: The river also became the river of Amrit, and the little boat was the chariot of the flesh, and the sails thereof the blood of the heart that beareth me, that beareth me.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV II:16
verse: O serpent woman of the stars! I, even I, have fashioned Thee from a pale image of fine gold.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV II:17
verse: Also the Holy One came upon me, and I beheld a white swan floating in the blue.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV II:18
verse: Between its wings I sate, and the aeons fled away.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV II:19
verse: Then the swan flew and dived and soared, yet no whither we went.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV II:20
verse: A little crazy boy that rode with me spake unto the swan, and said:

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV II:21
verse: Who art thou that dost float and fly and dive and soar in the inane? Behold, these many aeons have passed; whence camest thou? Whither wilt thou go?

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV II:22
verse: And laughing I chid him, saying: No whence! No whither!

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV II:23
verse: The swan being silent, he answered: Then, if with no goal, why this eternal journey?

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV II:24
verse: And I laid my head against the Head of the Swan, and laughed, saying: Is there not joy ineffable in this aimless winging? Is there not weariness and impatience for who would attain to some goal?

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV II:25
verse:
And the swan was ever silent. Ah! but we floated in the infinite Abyss. Joy! Joy!
White swan, bear thou ever me up between thy wings!

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV II:26
verse: O silence! O rapture! O end of things visible and invisible! This is all mine, who am Not.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV II:27
verse: Radiant God! Let me fashion an image of gems and gold for Thee! that the people may cast it down and trample it to dust! That Thy glory may be seen of them.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV II:28
verse: Nor shall it be spoken in the markets that I am come who should come; but Thy coming shall be the one word.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV II:29
verse: Thou shalt manifest Thyself in the unmanifest; in the secret places men shall meet with thee, and Thou shalt overcome them.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV II:30
verse: I saw a pale sad boy that lay upon the marble in the sunlight, and wept. By his side was the forgotten lute.(mg)Ah! but he wept.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV II:31
verse: Then came an eagle from the abyss of glory and overshadowed him. So black was the shadow that he was no more visible.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV II:32
verse: But I heard the lute lively discoursing through the blue still air.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV II:33
verse: Ah! messenger of the beloved One, let Thy shadow be over me!

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV II:34
verse:
Thy name is Death, it may be, or Shame, or Love.
So thou bringest me tidings of the Beloved One, I shall not ask thy name.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV II:35
verse:
Where is now the Master? cry the little crazy boys.
He is dead! He is shamed! He is wedded! and their mockery shall ring round the world.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV II:36
verse:
But the Master shall have had his reward.
The laughter of the mockers shall be a ripple in the hair of the Beloved One.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV II:37
verse: Behold! the Abyss of the Great Deep. Therein is a mighty dolphin, lashing his sides with the force of the waves.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV II:38
verse: There is also an harper of gold, playing infinite tunes.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV II:39
verse: Then the dolphin delighted therein, and put off his body, and became a bird.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV II:40
verse: The harper also laid aside his harp, and played infinite tunes upon the Pan-pipe.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV II:41
verse: Then the bird desired exceedingly this bliss, and laying down its wings became a faun of the forest.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV II:42
verse: The harper also laid down his Pan-pipe, and with the human voice sang his infinite tunes.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV II:43
verse: Then the faun was enraptured, and followed far; at last the harper was silent, and the faun became Pan in the midst of the primal forest of Eternity.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV II:44
verse: Thou canst not charm the dolphin with silence, O my prophet!

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV II:45
verse: Then the adept was rapt away in bliss, and the beyond of bliss, and exceeded the excess of excess.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV II:46
verse: Also his body shook and staggered with the burden of that bliss and that excess and that ultimate nameless.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV II:47
verse: They cried He is drunk or He is mad or He is in pain or He is about to die; and he heard them not.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV II:48
verse: O my Lord, my beloved! How shall I indite songs, when even the memory of the shadow of thy glory is a thing beyond all music of speech or of silence?

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV II:49
verse: Behold! I am a man. Even a little child might not endure Thee. And lo!

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV II:50
verse: I was alone in a great park, and by a certain hillock was a ring of deep enamelled grass wherein green-clad ones, most beautiful, played.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV II:51
verse:
In their play I came even unto the land of Fairy Sleep.
All my thoughts were clad in green; most beautiful were they.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV II:52
verse: All night they danced and sang; but Thou art the morning, O my darling, my serpent that twinest Thee about this heart.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV II:53
verse: I am the heart, and Thou the serpent. Wind Thy coils closer about me, so that no light nor bliss may penetrate.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV II:54
verse: Crush out the blood of me, as a grape upon the tongue of a white Doric girl that languishes with her lover in the moonlight.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV II:55
verse:
Then let the End awake. Long hast thou slept, O great God Terminus! Long ages hast thou waited at the end of the city and the roads thereof.
Awake Thou! wait no more!

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV II:56
verse: Nay, Lord! but I am come to Thee. It is I that wait at last.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV II:57
verse: The prophet cried against the mountain; come thou hither, that I may speak with thee!

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV II:58
verse: The mountain stirred not. Therefore went the prophet unto the mountain, and spake unto it. But the feet of the prophet were weary, and the mountain heard not his voice.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV II:59
verse: But I have called unto Thee, and I have journeyed unto Thee, and it availed me not.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV II:60
verse: I waited patiently, and Thou wast with me from the beginning.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV II:61
verse: This now I know, O my beloved, and we are stretched at our ease among the vines.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV II:62
verse: But these thy prophets; they must cry aloud and scourge themselves; they must cross trackless wastes and unfathomed oceans; to await Thee is the end, not the beginning.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV II:63
verse: Let darkness cover up the writing! Let the scribe depart among his ways.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV II:64
verse: But thou and I are stretched at our ease among the vines; what is he?

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV II:65
verse: O Thou beloved One! is there not an end? Nay, but there is an end. Awake! arise! gird up thy limbs, O thou runner; bear thou the Word unto the mighty cities, yea, unto the mighty cities.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV III:1
verse: Verily and Amen! I passed through the deep sea, and by the rivers of running water that abound therein, and I came unto the Land of No Desire.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV III:2
verse: Wherein was a white unicorn with a silver collar, whereon was graven the aphorism Linea viridis gyrat universa.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV III:3
verse: Then the word of Adonai came unto me by the mouth of the Magister mine, saying: O heart that art girt about with the coils of the old serpent, lift up thyself unto the mountain of initiation!

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV III:4
verse: But I remembered. Yea, Than, yea, Theli, yea, Lilith! these three were about me from of old. For they are one.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV III:5
verse: Beautiful wast thou, O Lilith, thou serpent-woman!

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV III:6
verse: Thou wast lithe and delicious to the taste, and thy perfume was of musk mingled with ambergris.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV III:7
verse: Close didst thou cling with thy coils unto the heart, and it was as the joy of all the spring.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV III:8
verse: But I beheld in thee a certain taint, even in that wherein I delighted.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV III:9
verse: I beheld in thee the taint of thy father the ape, of thy grandsire the Blind Worm of Slime.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV III:10
verse: I gazed upon the Crystal of the Future, and I saw the horror of the End of thee.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV III:11
verse: Further, I destroyed the time Past, and the time to Come --- had I not the Power of the Sand-glass?

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV III:12
verse: But in the very hour I beheld corruption.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV III:13
verse: Then I said: O my beloved, O Lord Adonai, I pray thee to loosen the coils of the serpent!

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV III:14
verse: But she was closed fast upon me, so that my Force was stayed in its inception.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV III:15
verse: Also I prayed unto the Elephant God, the Lord of Beginnings, who breaketh down obstruction.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV III:16
verse: These gods came right quickly to mine aid. I beheld them; I joined myself unto them; I was lost in their vastness.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV III:17
verse: Then I beheld myself compassed about with the Infinite Circle of Emerald that encloseth the Universe.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV III:18
verse: O Snake of Emerald, Thou hast no time Past, no time To Come. Verily Thou art not.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV III:19
verse: Thou art delicious beyond all taste and touch, Thou art not-to-be-beheld for glory, Thy voice is beyond the Speech and the Silence and the Speech therein, and Thy perfume is of pure ambergris, that is not weighed against the finest gold of the fine gold.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV III:20
verse: Also Thy coils are of infinite range; the Heart that Thou dost encircle is an Universal Heart.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV III:21
verse: I, and Me, and Mine were sitting with lutes in the market-place of the great city, the city of the violets and the roses.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV III:22
verse: The night fell, and the music of the lutes was stilled.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV III:23
verse: The tempest arose, and the music of the lutes was stilled.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV III:24
verse: The hour passed, and the music of the lutes was stilled.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV III:25
verse: But Thou art Eternity and Space; Thou art Matter and Motion; and Thou art the negation of all these things.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV III:26
verse: For there is no Symbol of Thee.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV III:27
verse: If I say Come up upon the mountains! the celestial waters flow at my word. But thou art the Water beyond the waters.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV III:28
verse: The red three-angled heart hath been set up in Thy shrine; for the priests despised equally the shrine and the god.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV III:29
verse: Yet all the while Thou wast hidden therein, as the Lord of Silence is hidden in the buds of the lotus.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV III:30
verse: Thou art Sebek the crocodile against Asar; thou art Mati, the Slayer in the Deep. Thou art Typhon, the Wrath of the Elements, O Thou who transcendest the Forces in their Concourse and Cohesion, in their Death and their Disruption. Thou art Python, the terrible serpent about the end of all things!

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV III:31
verse: I turned me about thrice in every way; and always I came at the last unto Thee.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV III:32
verse: Many things I beheld mediate and immediate; but, beholding them no more, I beheld Thee.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV III:33
verse: Come thou, O beloved One, O Lord God of the Universe, O Vast One, O Minute One! I am Thy beloved.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV III:34
verse: All day I sing of Thy delight; all night I delight in Thy song.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV III:35
verse: There is no other day or night than this.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV III:36
verse: Thou art beyond the day and the night; I am Thyself, O my Maker, my Master, my Mate!

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV III:37
verse: I am like the little red dog that sitteth upon the knees of the Unknown.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV III:38
verse: Thou hast brought me into great delight. Thou hast given me of Thy flesh to eat and of Thy blood for an offering of intoxication.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV III:39
verse: Thou hast fastened the fangs of Eternity in my soul, and the Poison of the Infinite hath consumed me utterly.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV III:40
verse: I am become like a luscious devil of Italy; a fair strong woman with worn cheeks, eaten out with hunger for kisses. She hath played the harlot in divers palaces; she hath given her body to the beasts.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV III:41
verse: She hath slain her kinsfolk with strong venom of toads; she hath been scourged with many rods.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV III:42
verse: She hath been broken in pieces upon the Wheel; the hands of the hangman have bound her unto it.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV III:43
verse: The fountains of water have been loosed upon her; she hath struggled with exceeding torment.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV III:44
verse: She hath burst in sunder with the weight of the waters; she hath sunk into the awful Sea.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV III:45
verse: So am I, O Adonai, my lord, and such are the waters of Thine intolerable Essence.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV III:46
verse: So am I, O Adonai, my beloved, and Thou hast burst me utterly in sunder.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV III:47
verse: I am shed out like spilt blood upon the mountains; the Ravens of Dispersion have borne me utterly away.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV III:48
verse: Therefore is the seal unloosed, that guarded the Eighth abyss; therefore is the vast sea as a veil; therefore is there a rending asunder of all things.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV III:49
verse: Yea, also verily Thou art the cool still water of the wizard fount. I have bathed in Thee, and lost me in Thy stillness.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV III:50
verse: That which went in as a brave boy of beautiful limbs cometh forth as a maiden, as a little child for perfection.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV III:51
verse: O Thou light and delight, ravish me away into the milky ocean of the stars!

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV III:52
verse: O Thou Son of a light-transcending mother, blessed be Thy name, and the Name of Thy Name, throughout the ages!

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV III:53
verse: Behold! I am a butterfly at the Source of Creation; let me die before the hour, falling dead into thine infinite stream!

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV III:54
verse: Also the stream of the stars floweth ever majestical unto the Abode; bear me away upon the Bosom of Nuit!

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV III:55
verse: This is the world of the waters of Maim; this is the bitter water that becometh sweet. Thou art beautiful and bitter, O golden one, O my Lord Adonai, O thou Abyss of Sapphire!

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV III:56
verse: I follow Thee, and the waters of Death fight strenuously against me. I pass unto the Waters beyond Death and beyond Life.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV III:57
verse: How shall I answer the foolish man? In no way shall he come to the Identity of Thee!

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV III:58
verse: But I am the Fool that heedeth not the Play of the Magician. Me doth the Woman of the Mysteries instruct in vain; I have burst the bonds of Love and of Power and of Worship.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV III:59
verse: Therefore is the Eagle made one with the Man, and the gallows of infamy dance with the fruit of the just.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV III:60
verse: I have descended, O my darling, into the black shining waters, and I have plucked Thee forth as a black pearl of infinite preciousness.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV III:61
verse: I have gone down, O my God, into the abyss of the all, and I have found Thee in the midst under the guise of No Thing.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV III:62
verse: But as Thou art the Last, Thou art also the Next, and as the Next do I reveal Thee to the multitude.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV III:63
verse: They that ever desired Thee shall obtain Thee, even at the End of their Desire.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV III:64
verse: Glorious, glorious, glorious art Thou, O my lover supernal, O Self of myself.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV III:65
verse: For I have found Thee alike in the Me and the Thee; there is no difference, O my beautiful, my desirable One! In the One and the Many have I found Thee; yea, I have found Thee.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV IV:1
verse: O crystal heart! I the Serpent clasp Thee; I drive home mine head into the central core of Thee, O God my beloved.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV IV:2
verse: Even as on the resounding wind-swept heights of Mitylene some god-like woman casts aside the lyre, and with her locks aflame as an aureole, plunges into the wet heart of the creation, so I, O Lord my God!

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV IV:3
verse: There is a beauty unspeakable in this heart of corruption, where the flowers are aflame.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV IV:4
verse: Ah me! but the thirst of Thy joy parches up this throat, so that I cannot sing.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV IV:5
verse: I will make me a little boat of my tongue, and explore the unknown rivers. It may be that the everlasting salt may turn to sweetness, and that my life may be no longer athirst.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV IV:6
verse: O ye that drink of the brine of your desire, ye are nigh to madness! Your torture increaseth as ye drink, yet still ye drink. Come up through the creeks to the fresh water; I shall be waiting for you with my kisses.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV IV:7
verse: As the bezoar-stone that is found in the belly of the cow, so is my lover among lovers.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV IV:8
verse: O honey boy! Bring me Thy cool limbs hither! Let us sit awhile in the orchard, until the sun go down! Let us feast on the cool grass! Bring wine, ye slaves, that the cheeks of my boy may flush red.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV IV:9
verse: In the garden of immortal kisses, O thou brilliant One, shine forth! Make Thy mouth an opium-poppy, that one kiss is the key to the infinite sleep and lucid, the sleep of Shi-loh-am.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV IV:10
verse: In my sleep I beheld the Universe like a clear crystal without one speck.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV IV:11
verse: There are purse-proud penniless ones that stand at the door of the tavern and prate of their feats of wine-bibbing.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV IV:12
verse: There are purse-proud penniless ones that stand at the door of the tavern and revile the guests.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV IV:13
verse: The guests dally upon couches of mother-of-pearl in the garden; the noise of the foolish men is hidden from them.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV IV:14
verse: Only the inn-keeper feareth lest the favour of the king be withdrawn from him.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV IV:15
verse: Thus spake the Magister V.V.V.V.V. unto Adonai his God, as they played together in the starlight over against the deep black pool that is in the Holy Place of the Holy House beneath the Altar of the Holiest One.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV IV:16
verse: But Adonai laughed, and played more languidly.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV IV:17
verse: Then the scribe took note, and was glad. But Adonai had no fear of the Magician and his play. For it was Adonai who had taught all his tricks to the Magician.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV IV:18
verse: And the Magister entered into the play of the Magician. When the Magician laughed he laughed; all as a man should do.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV IV:19
verse: And Adonai said: Thou art enmeshed in the web of the Magician. This He said subtly, to try him.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV IV:20
verse: But the Magister gave the sign of the Magistry, and laughed back on Him: O Lord, O beloved, did these fingers relax on Thy curls, or these eyes turn away from Thine eye?

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV IV:21
verse: And Adonai delighted in him exceedingly.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV IV:22
verse: Yea, O my master, thou art the beloved of the Beloved One; the Bennu Bird is set up in Philae not in vain.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV IV:23
verse: I who was the priestess of Ahathoor rejoice in your love.(mg)Arise, O Nile-God, and devour the holy place of the(mg)Cow of Heaven! Let the milk of the stars be drunk up by Sebek the dweller of Nile!

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV IV:24
verse: Arise, O serpent Apep, Thou art Adonai the beloved one! Thou art my darling and my lord, and Thy poison is sweeter than the kisses of Isis the mother of the Gods!

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV IV:25
verse: For Thou art He! Yea, Thou shalt swallow up Asi and Asar, and the children of Ptah. Thou shalt pour forth a flood of poison to destroy the works of the Magician.(mg)Only the Destroyer shall devour Thee; Thou shalt blacken his throat, wherein his spirit abideth. Ah, serpent Apep, but I love Thee!

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV IV:26
verse: My God! Let Thy secret fang pierce to the marrow of the little secret bone that I have kept against the Day of Vengeance of Hoor-Ra. Let Kheph-Ra sound his sharded drone! let the jackals of Day and Night howl in the wilderness of Time! let the Towers of the Universe totter, and the guardians hasten away! For my Lord hath revealed Himself as a mighty serpent, and my heart is the blood of His body.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV IV:27
verse: I am like a love-sick courtesan of Corinth. I have toyed with kings and captains, and made them my slaves. To-day I am the slave of the little asp of death; and who shall loosen our love?

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV IV:28
verse: Weary, weary! saith the scribe, who shall lead me to the sight of the Rapture of my master?

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV IV:29
verse: The body is weary and the soul is sore weary and sleep weighs down their eyelids; yet ever abides the sure consciousness of ecstacy, unknown, yet known in that its being is certain. O Lord, be my helper, and bring me to the bliss of the Beloved!

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV IV:30
verse: I came to the house of the Beloved, and the wine was like fire that flieth with green wings through the world of waters.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV IV:31
verse: I felt the red lips of nature and the black lips of perfection. Like sisters they fondled me their little brother; they decked me out as a bride; they mounted me for Thy bridal chamber.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV IV:32
verse: They fled away at Thy coming; I was alone before Thee.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV IV:33
verse: I trembled at Thy coming, O my God, for Thy messenger was more terrible than the Death-star.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV IV:34
verse: On the threshold stood the fulminant figure of Evil, the Horror of emptiness, with his ghastly eyes like poisonous wells. He stood, and the chamber was corrupt; the air stank. He was an old and gnarled fish more hideous than the shells of Abaddon.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV IV:35
verse: He enveloped me with his demon tentacles; yea, the eight fears took hold upon me.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV IV:36
verse: But I was anointed with the right sweet oil of the Magister; I slipped from the embrace as a stone from the sling of a boy of the woodlands.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV IV:37
verse: I was smooth and hard as ivory; the horror gat no hold.(mg)Then at the noise of the wind of Thy coming he was dissolved away, and the abyss of the great void was unfolded before me.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV IV:38
verse: Across the waveless sea of eternity Thou didst ride with Thy captains and Thy hosts; with Thy chariots and horsemen and spearmen didst Thou travel through the blue.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV IV:39
verse: Before I saw Thee Thou wast already with me; I was smitten through by Thy marvellous spear.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV IV:40
verse: I was stricken as a bird by the bolt of the thunderer; I was pierced as the thief by the Lord of the Garden.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV IV:41
verse: O my Lord, let us sail upon the sea of blood!

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV IV:42
verse: There is a deep taint beneath the ineffable bliss; it is the taint of generation.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV IV:43
verse: Yea, though the flower wave bright in the sunshine, the root is deep in the darkness of earth.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV IV:44
verse: Praise to thee, O beautiful dark earth, thou art the mother of a million myriads of myriads of flowers.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV IV:45
verse: Also I beheld my God, and the countenance of Him was a thousandfold brighter than the lightning. Yet in his heart I beheld the slow and dark One, the ancient one, the devourer of His children.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV IV:46
verse: In the height and the abyss, O my beautiful, there is no thing, verily, there is no thing at all, that is not altogether and perfectly fashioned for Thy delight.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV IV:47
verse: Light cleaveth unto Light, and filth to filth; with pride one contemneth another. But not Thou, who art all, and beyond it; who art absolved from the Division of the Shadows.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV IV:48
verse: O day of Eternity, let Thy wave break in foamless glory of sapphire upon the laborious coral of our making!

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV IV:49
verse: We have made us a ring of glistening white sand, strewn wisely in the midst of the Delightful Ocean.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV IV:50
verse: Let the palms of brilliance flower upon our island; we shall eat of their fruit, and be glad.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV IV:51
verse: But for me the lustral water, the great ablution, the dissolving of the soul in that resounding abyss.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV IV:52
verse: I have a little son like a wanton goat; my daughter is like an unfledged eaglet; they shall get them fins, that they may swim.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV IV:53
verse: That they may swim, O my beloved, swim far in the warm honey of Thy being, O blessed one, O boy of beatitude!

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV IV:54
verse: This heart of mine is girt about with the serpent that devoureth his own coils.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV IV:55
verse: When shall there be an end, O my darling, O when shall the Universe and the Lord thereof be utterly swallowed up?

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV IV:56
verse: Nay! who shall devour the Infinite? who shall undo the Wrong of the Beginning?

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV IV:57
verse: Thou criest like a white cat upon the roof of the Universe; there is none to answer Thee.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV IV:58
verse: Thou art like a lonely pillar in the midst of the sea; there is none to behold Thee, O Thou who beholdest all!

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV IV:59
verse: Thou dost faint, thou dost fail, thou scribe; cried the desolate Voice; but I have filled thee with a wine whose savour thou knowest not.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV IV:60
verse: It shall avail to make drunken the people of the old gray sphere that rolls in the infinite Far-off; they shall lap the wine as dogs that lap the blood of a beautiful courtesan pierced through by the Spear of a swift rider through the city.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV IV:61
verse: I too am the Soul of the desert; thou shalt seek me yet again in the wilderness of sand.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV IV:62
verse: At thy right hand a great lord and a comely; at thy left hand a woman clad in gossamer and gold and having the stars in her hair. Ye shall journey far into a land of pestilence and evil; ye shall encamp in the river of a foolish city forgotten; there shall ye meet with Me.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV IV:63
verse: There will I make Mine habitation; as for bridal will I come bedecked and anointed; there shall the Consummation be accomplished.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV IV:64
verse: O my darling, I also wait for the brilliance of the hour ineffable, when the universe shall be like a girdle for the midst of the ray of our love, extending beyond the permitted end of the endless One.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV IV:65
verse: Then, O thou heart, will I the serpent eat thee wholly up; yea, I will eat thee wholly up.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV V:1
verse: Ah! my Lord Adonai, that dalliest with the Magister in the Treasure-House of Pearls, let me listen to the echo of your kisses.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV V:2
verse: Is not the starry heaven shaken as a leaf at the tremulous rapture of your love? Am not I the flying spark of light whirled away by the great wind of your perfection?

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV V:3
verse: Yea, cried the Holy One, and from Thy spark will I the Lord kindle a great light; I will burn through the great city in the old and desolate land; I will cleanse it from its great impurity.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV V:4
verse: And thou, O prophet, shalt see these things, and thou shalt heed them not.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV V:5
verse: Now is the Pillar established in the Void; now is Asi fulfilled of Asar; now is Hoor let down into the Animal Soul of Things like a fiery star that falleth upon the darkness of the earth.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV V:6
verse: Through the midnight thou art dropt, O my child, my conqueror, my sword-girt captain, O Hoor! and they shall find thee as a black gnarl'd glittering stone, and they shall worship thee.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV V:7
verse: My prophet shall prophesy concerning thee; around thee the maidens shall dance, and bright babes be born unto them. Thou shalt inspire the proud ones with infinite pride, and the humble ones with an ecstasy of abasement; all this shall transcend the Known and the Unknown with somewhat that hath no name. For it is as the abyss of the Arcanum that is opened in the secret Place of Silence.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV V:8
verse: Thou hast come hither, O my prophet, through grave paths. Thou hast eaten of the dung of the Abominable Ones; thou hast prostrated thyself before the Goat and the Crocodile; the evil men have made thee a plaything; thou hast wandered as a painted harlot, ravishing with sweet scent and Chinese colouring, in the streets; thou hast darkened thine eyepits with Kohl; thou hast tinted thy lips with vermilion; thou hast plastered thy cheeks with ivory enamels. Thou hast played the wanton in every gate and by-way of the great city. The men of the city have lusted after thee to abuse thee and to beat thee. They have mouthed the golden spangles of fine dust(mg)wherewith thou didst bedeck thine hair; they have scourged the painted flesh of thee with their whips; thou hast suffered unspeakable things.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV V:9
verse: But I have burnt within thee as a pure flame without oil. In the midnight I was brighter than the moon; in the daytime I exceeded utterly the sun; in the byways of of thy being I inflamed, and dispelled the illusion.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV V:10
verse: Therefore thou art wholly pure before Me; therefore thou art My virgin unto eternity.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV V:11
verse: Therefore I love thee with surpassing love; therefore they that despise thee shall adore thee.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV V:12
verse: Thou shalt be lovely and pitiful toward them; thou shalt heal them of the unutterable evil.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV V:13
verse: They shall change in their destruction, even as two dark stars that crash together in the abyss, and blaze up in an infinite burning.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV V:14
verse: All this while did Adonai pierce my being with his sword that hath four blades; the blade of the thunderbolt, the blade of the Pylon, the blade of the serpent, the blade of the Phallus.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV V:15
verse: Also he taught me the holy unutterable word Ararita, so that I melted the sixfold gold into a single invisible point, whereof naught may be spoken.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV V:16
verse: For the Magistry of this Opus is a secret magistry; and the sign of the master thereof is a certain ring of lapis-lazuli with the name of my master, who am I, and the Eye in the Midst thereof.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV V:17
verse: Also He spake and said: This is a secret sign, and thou shalt not disclose it unto the profane, nor unto the neophyte, nor unto the zelator, nor unto the practicus, nor unto the philosophus, nor unto the lesser adept, nor unto the greater adept.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV V:18
verse: But unto the exempt adept thou shalt disclose thyself if thou have need of him for the lesser operations of thine art.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV V:19
verse: Accept the worship of the foolish people, whom thou hatest. The Fire is not defiled by the altars of the Ghebers, nor is the Moon contaminated by the incense of them that adore the Queen of Night.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV V:20
verse: Thou shalt dwell among the people as a precious diamond among cloudy diamonds, and crystals, and pieces of glass. Only the eye of the just merchant shall behold thee, and plunging in his hand shall single thee out and glorify thee before men.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV V:21
verse: But thou shalt heed none of this. Thou shalt be ever the heart, and I the serpent will coil close about thee. My coil shall never relax throughout the aeons. Neither change nor sorrow nor unsubstantiality shall have thee; for thou art passed beyond all these.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV V:22
verse: Even as the diamond shall glow red for the rose, and green for the rose-leaf; so shalt thou abide apart from the Impressions.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV V:23
verse: I am thou, and the Pillar is 'stablished in the void.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV V:24
verse: Also thou art beyond the stabilities of Being and of Consciousness and of Bliss; for I am thou, and the Pillar is 'stablished in the void.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV V:25
verse: Also thou shalt discourse of these things unto the man that writeth them, and he shall partake of them as a sacrament; for I who am thou am he, and the Pillar is 'stablished in the void.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV V:26
verse: From the Crown to the Abyss, so goeth it single and erect. Also the limitless sphere shall glow with the brilliance thereof.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV V:27
verse: Thou shalt rejoice in the pools of adorable water; thou shalt bedeck thy damsels with pearls of fecundity; thou shalt light flame like licking tongues of liquor of the Gods between the pools.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV V:28
verse: Also thou shalt convert the all-sweeping air into the winds of pale water, thou shalt transmute the earth into a blue abyss of wine.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV V:29
verse: Ruddy are the gleams of ruby and gold that sparkle therein; one drop shall intoxicate the Lord of the Gods my servant.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV V:30
verse: Also Adonai spake unto V.V.V.V.V. saying: O my little one, my tender one, my little amorous one, my gazelle, my beautiful, my boy, let us fill up the pillar of the Infinite with an infinite kiss!

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV V:31
verse: So that the stable was shaken and the unstable became still.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV V:32
verse: They that beheld it cried with a formidable affright: The end of things is come upon us.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV V:33
verse: And it was even so.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV V:34
verse: Also I was in the spirit vision and beheld a parricidal pomp of atheists, coupled by two and by two in the supernal ecstasy of the stars. They did laugh and rejoice exceedingly, being clad in purple robes and drunken with purple wine, and their whole soul was one purple flower-flame of holiness.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV V:35
verse: They beheld not God; they beheld not the Image of God; therefore were they arisen to the Palace of the Splendour Ineffable. A sharp sword smote out before them, and the worm Hope writhed in its death-agony under their feet.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV V:36
verse: Even as their rapture shore asunder the visible Hope, so also the Fear Invisible fled away and was no more.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV V:37
verse: O ye that are beyond Aormuzdi and Ahrimanes! blessed are ye unto the ages.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV V:38
verse: They shaped Doubt as a sickle, and reaped the flowers of Faith for their garlands.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV V:39
verse: They shaped Ecstasy as a spear, and pierced the ancient dragon that sat upon the stagnant water.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV V:40
verse: Then the fresh springs were unloosed, that the folk athirst might be at ease.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV V:41
verse: And again I was caught up into the presence of my Lord Adonai, and the knowledge and Conversation of the Holy One, and Angel that Guardeth me.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV V:42
verse: O Holy Exalted One, O Self beyond self. O Self-Luminous Image of the Unimaginable Naught, O my darling, my beautiful, come Thou forth and follow me.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV V:43
verse: Adonai, divine Adonai, let Adonai initiate refulgent dalliance! Thus I concealed the name of Her name that inspireth my rapture, the scent of whose body bewildereth the soul, the light of whose soul abaseth this body unto the beasts.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV V:44
verse: I have sucked out the blood with my lips; I have drained Her beauty of its sustenance; I have abased Her before me, I have mastered Her, I have possessed Her, and Her life is within me. In Her blood I inscribe the secret riddles of the Sphinx of the Gods, that none shall understand, --- save only the pure and voluptuous, the chaste and obscene, the androgyne and the gynander that have passed beyond the bars of the prison that the old Slime of Khem set up in the Gates of Amennti.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV V:45
verse: O my adorable, my delicious one, all night will I pour out the libation on Thine altars; all night will I burn the sacrifice of blood; all night will I swing the thurible of my delight before Thee, and the fervour of the orisons shall intoxicate Thy nostrils.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV V:46
verse: O Thou who camest from the land of the Elephant, girt about with the tiger's pell, and garlanded with the lotus of the spirit, do Thou inebriate my life with Thy madness, that She leap at my passing.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV V:47
verse: Bid Thy maidens who follow Thee bestrew us a bed of flowers immortal, that we may take our pleasure thereupon. Bid Thy satyrs heap thorns among the flowers, that we may take our pain thereupon. Let the pleasure and pain be mingled in one supreme offering unto the Lord Adonai!

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV V:48
verse: Also I heard the voice of Adonai the Lord the desirable one concerning that which is beyond.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV V:49
verse: Let not the dwellers in Thebai and the temples thereof prate ever of the Pillars of Hercules and the Ocean of the West. Is not the Nile a beautiful water?

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV V:50
verse: Let not the priest of Isis uncover the nakedness of Nuit, for every step is a death and a birth. The priest of Isis lifted the veil of Isis, and was slain by the kisses of her mouth. Then was he the priest of Nuit, and drank of the milk of the stars.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV V:51
verse: Let not the failure and the pain turn aside the worshippers. The foundations of the pyramid were hewn in the living rock ere sunset; did the king weep at dawn that the crown of the pyramid was yet unquarried in the distant land?

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV V:52
verse: There was also an humming-bird that spake unto the horned cerastes, and prayed him for poison. And the great snake of Khem the Holy One, the royal Uraeus serpent, answered him and said:

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV V:53
verse: I sailed over the sky of Nu in the car called Millions-of-Years, and I saw not any creature upon Seb that was equal to me. The venom of my fang is the inheritance of my father, and of my father's father; and how shall I give it unto thee? Live thou and thy children as I and my fathers have lived, even unto an hundred millions of generations, and it may be that the mercy of the Mighty Ones may bestow upon thy children a drop of the poison of eld.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV V:54
verse: Then the humming-bird was afflicted in his spirit, and he flew unto the flowers, and it was as if naught had been spoken between them. Yet in a little while a serpent struck him that he died.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV V:55
verse: But an Ibis that meditated upon the bank of Nile the beautiful god listened and heard. And he laid aside his Ibis ways, and became as a serpent, saying Peradventure in an hundred millions of millions of generations of my children, they shall attain to a drop of the poison of the fang of the Exalted One.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV V:56
verse: And behold! ere the moon waxed thrice he became an Uraeus serpent, and the poison of the fang was established in him and his seed even for ever and for ever.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV V:57
verse: O thou Serpent Apep, my Lord Adonai, it is a speck of minutest time, this travelling through eternity, and in Thy sight the landmarks are of fair white marble untouched by the tool of the graver. Therefore thou art mine, even now and for ever and for everlasting. Amen.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV V:58
verse: Moreover, I heard the voice of Adonai: Seal up the book of the Heart and the Serpent; in the number five and sixty seal thou the holy book. As fine gold that is beaten into a diadem for the fair queen of Pharaoh, as great stones that are cemented together into the Pyramid of the ceremony of the Death of Asar, so do thou bind together the words and the deeds, so that in all is one Thought of Me thy delight Adonai.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV V:59
verse: And I answered and said: It is done even according unto Thy word. And it was done. And they that read the book and debated thereon passed into the desolate land of Barren Words. And they that sealed up the book into their blood were the chosen of Adonai, and the Thought of Adonai was a Word and a Deed; and they abode in the Land that the far-off travellers call Naught.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV V:60
verse: O land beyond honey and spice and all perfection! I will dwell therein with my Lord for ever.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV V:61
verse: And the Lord Adonai delighteth in me, and I bear the Cup of His gladness unto the weary ones of the old grey land.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV V:62
verse: They that drink thereof are smitten of disease; the abomination hath hold upon them, and their torment is like the thick black smoke of the evil abode.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV V:63
verse: But the chosen ones drank thereof, and became even as my Lord, my beautiful, my desirable one. There is no wine like unto this wine.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV V:64
verse: They are gathered together into a glowing heart, as Ra that gathereth his clouds about Him at eventide into a molten sea of Joy; and the snake that is the crown of Ra bindeth them about with the golden girdle of the death-kisses.

title: Liber Cordis cincti serpente.
label: LIBER LXV V:65
verse: So also is the end of the book, and the Lord Adonai is about it on all sides like a Thunderbolt, and a Pylon, and a Snake, and a Phallus, and in the midst thereof he is like the Woman that jetteth out the milk of the stars from her paps; yea, the milk of the stars from her paps.

title: Liber Stellae Rubeae
label: LIBER LXVI I:1
verse: Apep deifieth Asar.

title: Liber Stellae Rubeae
label: LIBER LXVI I:2
verse: Let excellent virgins evoke rejoicing, son of Night!

title: Liber Stellae Rubeae
label: LIBER LXVI I:3
verse: This is the book of the most secret cult of the Ruby Star. It shall be given to none, save to the shameless in deed as in word.

title: Liber Stellae Rubeae
label: LIBER LXVI I:4
verse: No man shall understand this writing --- it is too subtle for the sons of men.

title: Liber Stellae Rubeae
label: LIBER LXVI I:5
verse: If the Ruby Star have shed its blood upon thee; if in the season of the moon thou hast invoked by the Iod and the Pe, then mayest thou partake of this most secret sacrament.

title: Liber Stellae Rubeae
label: LIBER LXVI I:6
verse: One shall instruct another, with no care for the matters of men's thought.

title: Liber Stellae Rubeae
label: LIBER LXVI I:7
verse: There shall be a fair altar in the midst, extended upon a black stone.

title: Liber Stellae Rubeae
label: LIBER LXVI I:8
verse: At the head of the altar gold, and twin images in green of the Master.

title: Liber Stellae Rubeae
label: LIBER LXVI I:9
verse: In the midst a cup of green wine.

title: Liber Stellae Rubeae
label: LIBER LXVI I:10
verse: At the foot the Star of Ruby.

title: Liber Stellae Rubeae
label: LIBER LXVI I:11
verse: The altar shall be entirely bare.

title: Liber Stellae Rubeae
label: LIBER LXVI I:12
verse: First, the ritual of the Flaming Star.

title: Liber Stellae Rubeae
label: LIBER LXVI I:13
verse: Next, the ritual of the Seal.

title: Liber Stellae Rubeae
label: LIBER LXVI I:14
verse:
Next, the infernal adorations of OAI
Mu pa telai,
Tu wa melai
a, a, a.
Tu fu tulu!
Tu fu tulu
Pa, Sa, Ga.
Qwi Mu telai
Ya Pu melai;
u, u, u.
'Se gu malai;
Pe fu telai,
Fu tu lu.
O chi balae
Wa pa malae: --- 
Ut! Ut! Ut!
Ge; fu latrai,
Le fu malai
Kut! Hut! Nut!
Al OAI
Rel moai
Ti --- Ti --- Ti!
Wa la pelai
Tu fu latai
Wi, Ni, Bi.

title: Liber Stellae Rubeae
label: LIBER LXVI I:15
verse: Also thou shalt excite the wheels with the five wounds and the five wounds.

title: Liber Stellae Rubeae
label: LIBER LXVI I:16
verse: Then thou shalt excite the wheels with the two and the third in the midst; even <<Saturn>> and <<Jupiter>>, <<Sun>> and <<Moon>>, <<Mars>> and <<Venus>>, and <<Mercury>>.

title: Liber Stellae Rubeae
label: LIBER LXVI I:17
verse: Then the five --- and the sixth.

title: Liber Stellae Rubeae
label: LIBER LXVI I:18
verse: Also the altar shall fume before the master with incense that hath no smoke.

title: Liber Stellae Rubeae
label: LIBER LXVI I:19
verse: That which is to be denied shall be denied; that which is to be trampled shall be trampled; that which is to be spat upon shall be spat upon.

title: Liber Stellae Rubeae
label: LIBER LXVI I:20
verse: These things shall be burnt in the outer fire.

title: Liber Stellae Rubeae
label: LIBER LXVI I:21
verse: Then again the master shall speak as he will soft words, and with music and what else he will bring forward the Victim.

title: Liber Stellae Rubeae
label: LIBER LXVI I:22
verse: Also he shall slay a young child upon the altar, and the blood shall cover the altar with perfume as of roses.

title: Liber Stellae Rubeae
label: LIBER LXVI I:23
verse: Then shall the master appear as He should appear --- in His glory.

title: Liber Stellae Rubeae
label: LIBER LXVI I:24
verse: He shall stretch himself upon the altar, and awake it into life, and into death.

title: Liber Stellae Rubeae
label: LIBER LXVI I:25
verse: (For so we conceal that life which is beyond.)

title: Liber Stellae Rubeae
label: LIBER LXVI I:26
verse: The temple shall be darkened, save for the fire and the lamp of the altar.

title: Liber Stellae Rubeae
label: LIBER LXVI I:27
verse: There shall he kindle a great fire and a devouring.

title: Liber Stellae Rubeae
label: LIBER LXVI I:28
verse: Also he shall smite the altar with his scourge, and blood shall flow therefrom.

title: Liber Stellae Rubeae
label: LIBER LXVI I:29
verse: Also he shall have made roses bloom thereon.

title: Liber Stellae Rubeae
label: LIBER LXVI I:30
verse: In the end he shall offer up the Vast Sacrifice, at the moment when the God licks up the flame upon the altar.

title: Liber Stellae Rubeae
label: LIBER LXVI I:31
